author: .vbuterin
content:
> Do we accept that the block coinbase  lose funds from a transaction if gas price < BASEFEE because of fee cap ?
<@574864862338088960> Thr problem with allowing that is that a miner could choose someone else as coinbase and drain their money

author: .vbuterin
content: So we do need to enforce gasprice >= basefee

author: abdel.stark
content:
Thanks <@!273808422753796097> . Would be better to make it clear in the EIP specification. Currently it is stated 
If GASPRICE < BASEFEE (due to the FEECAP), this means that the block.coinbase loses funds from this operation; in this case, we check that the post-balance is non-negative and throw an exception if it is negative.

author: abdel.stark
content: I will implement a new block  validation rule to enforce this check in Besu. However Besu implementation will not be compatible anymore with Geth's current PR for this specific use case.
